Dear Ms. Gordy:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
R 400.12214 Compliance with 1975 PA 238.
Violation An agency shall develop a written plan and implement the
Type plan to assure compliance with 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621,
and known as the child protection law.
Allegation It is alleged that the agency failed to report suspected child
abuse/neglect.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 25,
2023, and July 20, 2023. The Complainant offered the following
information. During a Team Decision Meeting on April 24, 2023,
Staff 1, an agency worker, had stated in a de-briefing after the
FTM that Youth A, a foster child, had told her that her brother had
grouped her buttocks several times. Youth A and her brother, age
18, reside with their grandmother. The Complainant, who was
present at the meeting, informed the agency that a complaint
needed to be filed to Central Intake. The Complainant was
concerned that a complaint had not been filed until April 25, 2023.
The complainant was also concerned that a complaint had not
been filed earlier when the agency had learned that Youth A had
been touched a few years ago by her brother.
The agency Chief Administrator was informed of the
complaint via telephone on May 31, 2023. At that time the Chief
Administrator was interviewed. The Chief Administrator reported
that Staff 2, who was the agency case worker for Youth A from
April 1, 2022, to February 27, 2023, had reported previously that
Youth A had told her that her brother had touched her a few years
ago but denied that he had touched her breasts or genitals. Youth
A had gone AWOL from the grandmother’s house on February 20,
2023, and returned on April 17, 2023. The Chief Administrator
reported that Youth A had reported to Staff 2 that she went AWOL
because her brother was saying mean things to her. The Chief
Administrator reported that Staff 2 had reported that Youth A had
not disclosed any other information regarding being touched by
her brother.
2

Staff 2 was interviewed via video on June 27, 2023. Also
present was the Chief Administrator and Program Supervisor.
Staff 2 reported that Youth A had disclosed to her that her brother
had touched her when they were watching a movie and this
happened years ago. Staff 2 reported that Youth A had said that
he brushed her arm but denied that her brother had touched her
inappropriately. Staff 2 reported that when Youth A had gone
AWOL that Youth A texted her stating that her brother had said
hurtful things to her and he wants to hate her because he wants to
live with their grandmother alone.
The Program Supervisor confirmed the above statements of Staff
2.
The Chief Administrator reported that Staff 1 was assigned the
case on February 27, 2023, until June 19, 2023, when she left the
agency. The Chief Administrator reported that Staff 1 had reported
that Youth A had disclosed that her buttocks had been grabbed by
her brother. The Chief Administrator referred me to a social work
contact dated April 24, 2023, which describes the disclosure of the
touching.
The Program Supervisor was interviewed on July 20, 2023,
via telephone. The Program Supervisor confirmed she was
present at the April 24, 2023, TDM and the de-briefing afterwards.
The Program Supervisor reported that she could not recall if the
disclosure of the alleged touching had been disclosed and
discussed at the TDM or de-briefing. The Program Supervisor
reported that she informed Staff 1 to call Central Intake on April
25, 2023, when Staff 1 obtained more detailed information about
the alleged inappropriate touching and informed her about it.
Staff 1 was not interviewed as she had left the agency and could
not be contacted.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
File Review:
Social work contact. An April 17, 2023, contact was reviewed.
The contact, written by Staff 1, describes a post AWOL de-briefing
and questions asked of Youth A. Youth A’s response as to why
she went AWOL is as follows, “arguments with brother, possible
violation of boundaries, unspecified and would not speak further
on this issue enough to clarify what was going on, only that her
brother was creepy to her”.
3

Social work contact. An April 24, 2023, contact was reviewed.
The contact describes Staff 1 asking Youth A what exactly
happened between her and her brother. Youth A then reports that
starting at age 11 her brother had grouped her buttocks 5 or 6
times and again as recently as December 2022 or January 2023.
Email correspondence: An email correspondence, dated April
28, 2023, between the DHHS Monitor/Complainant, and the
agency Chief Administrator, was reviewed. The Complainant
expresses concern about Youth A being touched by her brother
years prior in a “flirtatious” manner and why the agency did not file
a complaint when learning of this behavior. The Chief
Administrator reported that the agency worker for Youth A had
stated that Youth A had reported she feels safe around her
brother and that she ran away from her grandmother’s home
because her brother said mean things to her.
Analysis The Complainant reported that Staff 1 had disclosed in a post
TDM de-briefing on April 24, 2023, that Youth A had disclosed to
her that her brother had grouped her buttocks several times. The
Complainant informed Staff 1 that she needed to file a complaint
regarding the allegation.
The Program Supervisor could not recall if the above conversation
occurred during the de-briefing.
The social work contact dated April 17, 2023, describes a possible
violation of boundaries with her brother and that Youth A thinks he
is creepy.
The social work contact dated April 24, 2023, documents how
Youth A had reported to Staff 1 that her brother had grabbed her
buttocks several times.
Staff 1 and the agency failed to call Central Intake until April 25,
2023, a full day after the alleged touching.
In addition, the agency had sufficient evidence on April 17, 2023,
to suspect that inappropriate touching may have been occurring
and did not file a complaint until April 25, 2023.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
